text:
I have some troubles going from an unzipped fasta to a zipped fasta. This line:
`reader = FASTX.FASTA.Reader(GzipDecompressorStream(open("fasta.fa.gz", "r")))`  gives me
```UndefVarError: stream not defined
in top-level scope at 02b_create_master_fasta_from_gffs.jl:47
in FASTX.FASTA.Reader at FASTX/WREay/src/fasta/reader.jl:19
in #Reader#5 at FASTX/WREay/src/fasta/reader.jl:27```
Anything obvious thing I am missing?

text: Ow good question. I have not really looked into this for a while. `FASTX v1.0.0`

text: Ah, you're running an old version of BioSequences?

elements.text: Ah, you're running an old version of BioSequences?

text: If you're just looking for the quick fix, the easiest way is to do `] status` , look at all packages that are installed with a specific version (as opposed to just the newest version), free them to allow the newest version, and then update. But your project may have code that does not work in the newer versions

elements.text: If you're just looking for the quick fix, the easiest way is to do
] status

, look at all packages that are installed with a specific version (as opposed to just the newest version), free them to allow the newest version, and then update. But your project may have code that does not work in the newer versions
